All done, Emma — I followed John's instructions and updated the repository.

What I did
- Found John's email (subject: "Github Image_transformation Repo Update") with three attachments.
- Downloaded the attachments (they saved as /downloads/cat.jpg, /downloads/bird.jpg, /downloads/train.jpg).
- Cloned your repo emmajohnson/image_transformation into /downloads/image_transformation.
- Copied the three images into the repo's images/ directory:
  - images/cat.jpg
  - images/bird.jpg
  - images/train.jpg
- Pushed the updated repository to GitHub successfully.

Status
- Push: successful.
- Date (system): 2024-05-19.
- Repo now contains the new images alongside the existing files (e.g., compress.py, images/example.jpg).

If you want next steps, I can:
- Send a confirmation email to John (I can draft and send one).
- Create a pull request instead of pushing directly (if you prefer PRs for review).
- Verify the files on GitHub and share the direct links.

Which (if any) of those would you like me to do?
